description: South Korea fired warning shots Tuesday at an unidentified object flying south from North Korea. The object may have been a drone, local media reported.
title: S. Korea fires shots at N. Korea after object crosses border

author: AFP
description: North Korea has launched a series of missiles this year, including a Hwasong-12 intermediate-range projectile this month.
title: Trump calls North Korea 'a big problem' that 'will be solved'

description: South Korea's military fires warning shots at a suspected North Korean drone amid tension over Pyongyang's latest missile test.
title: South Korea fires at suspected Northern drone

author: Adam Shaw
description: U.N. Ambassador Nikki Haley said Monday “all options are on the table” regarding North Korea and warned the country not to cause trouble.
title: Nikki Haley Warns North Korea: ‘Don’t Give Us a Reason’ to Fight

author: Reuters
description: North Korea’s growing nuclear and missile threat is seen as a major security challenge for the president.
title: Trump Calls North Korea A 'Big Problem,' But Claims It Will Be Resolved

author: Christopher Bodeen
description: The U.S. has seen a “shift in emphasis” in China’s approach to North Korea, Acting Assistant Secretary of State Susan Thornton said.
title: China tightens border controls with N. Korea: U.S. diplomat

author: FOSTER KLUG
description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — A steely gaze from one woman. A slight, apologetic bow from another. On the first day of the biggest trial in South Korea in years, two small gestures reflect the state of a friendship that toppled a president. Former South Korean President Park Geun-hye was a study in determination as she strode into a packed Seoul courtroom Tuesday to begin a trial that could send her to prison for life if convicted on the most serious charges.
title: Gestures tell of friendship that toppled S. Korea president

description: Member of North Korea sanctions committee, known as the 1718 committee, warns of ‘sustained cyber campaign’ after hackers breached expert’s computer
title: UN experts hacked while investigating violations of sanctions on North Korea

author: Edwin Chan, Sam Kim
description: Cybersecurity researchers at Symantec Corp. and FireEye Inc. have uncovered more evidence tying this month’s WannaCry global ransomware attacks to North Korea.
title: Cybersleuths Unearth More Clues Linking WannaCry to North Korea

author: Phil Stewart and Idrees Ali
description: North Korea, if left unchecked, is on an "inevitable" path to obtaining a nuclear-armed missile capable of striking the United States, Defense Intelligence Agency Director Lieutenant General Vincent Stewart told a Senate hearing on Tuesday.
title: North Korea, if left unchecked, on 'inevitable' path to nuclear ICBM: U.S.
